ygData.subject: Re: Assist Command?
ygData.msgSnippet: I think one of the social buttons is already setup for the Assist command.  If not, just modify one so that it is set to /assist, and then drag that social
ygData.messageBody:
I think one of the social buttons is already setup for the Assist
command. If not, just modify one so that it is set to /assist, and
then drag that social button over to your quickpad. Then, as
mentioned below, just hit F2-F6 to target your party member you want
to help and hit the 1-6 key you assigned the social Assist button to.
I've found that sometimes you have to have both the party member and
the monster they're attacking on your screen, or it might be that you
just have to be close to the party member when you do the /assist
command. This is a very important way to make sure everyone in the
group is attacking the same monster, if that is your goal.

Tigsen
15th level bard on Innoruuk

--- jay schultze <sartori69@...> wrote:
> From: "jay schultze" <sartori69@...>
>
>
>
> >From: Steve Fogle <steve.fogle@...>
> >Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
> >To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
> >Subject: Re: [eqbards] Assist Command?
> >Date: Wed, 2 Jun 1999 14:57:16 -0500
> >
> >From: Steve Fogle <steve.fogle@...>
> >
> >Type /assist char_name and you will target whatever mod that
> char is
> >fighting. You will also go into auto attack mode.
> >
> >Later,
> > Steve
> >
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Mott, Mike J. [mailto:MIKE.J.MOTT@...]
> >Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 2:33 PM
> >To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> >Subject: [eqbards] Assist Command?
> >
> >
> >From: "Mott, Mike J." <MIKE.J.MOTT@...>
> >
> >The ASSIST command? Am I missing something here? I have never
> heard of
> >this.
> >
> >--------------
> >
> >Lullaby can be very useful if you have a rogue and healer in your
> group and
> >fighting multiple mobs. While you sleep the rest of the mobs, the
> rogue
> >can
> >
> >backstab the one you are fighting and the cleric can heal you.
> But I
> >usually don't use lullaby unless there is a healer in the group
> and
> >everyone
> >
> >in the group knows what the ASSIST command is for.
> >
> >
> >Lago Bardoon, 21st Rank Bard of Bertox
> >
>
> I found that the quickest way to /assist someone in your party was
> to use
> the F keys that are already setup for targetting party members.
> Actually i
> modified mine. The default config is F2 for the first party member
> in your
> list all the way down to F6 for the last. I changed this to F1 thru
> F5 for
> party members, just easier for me to remember. I hit the F key for
> whoever i
> want to assist and quickly type "/ASS" which is the short version
> of
> "/ASSIST" =)
>
> No need to type out "/ASSIST JOEBLOW", takes too long, especially
> if the guy
> has a funky long name and you need to get in the fight quickly.
> /ASS works
> as long as you got a player targetted. Well, it usually works...the
> assist
> command can be touchy sometimes.
>
> I hope this helps!
>
> Sartori D'Elsiraad
> Bard of Kelethin of the 15th Chorus
> Veeshan
>
>
